entry.title: Re: SAP PO WSSE Security in SOAP adapter
entry.content:
Hi @jakob_steen-petersen 

To send the Username and Password in the SOAP Header WS-Security UsernameToken using the SOAP receiver adapter in SAP Process Orchestration (PO), you should use the WS-Security configuration in the SOAP communication channel.

Steps I suggest you should take:

  1. Open the SOAP Receiver Communication Channel.
  2. Go to the Module tab.
  3. Add the WS-Security Adapter Module:
    • For SAP PO, add the standard module com.sap.aii.security.lib - SecurityModule.
    • Configure the module so it adds the UsernameToken to the outbound SOAP message.
  4. Set your WS-Security Parameters:
    • In the channel or module parameters, set the following where available:
      • wsse.username: your username
      • wsse.password: your password
      • action: UsernameToken
    • These properties ensure that SAP PO generates and inserts the required XML in the <soap:Header>.
  5. Alternatively, you can use manual header injection only if automatic module is not feasible:
    • Use the Request Response Bean and a custom XSLT or Java mapping to add the WS-Security header.
    • This is less typical standard function via WS-Security module is preferred.

I hope this provides the necessary details. I am happy to help if you have further questions.

Best regards

Chris

 

Configure the SOAP (SOAP 1.x) Receiver Adapter

Migrate SOAP Axis (WS-Security) from SAP Process Orchestration(PO) to Cloud Integration(CI)

Configure User Authentication on SOAP Receiver Adapter

entry.title: Re: Production process
entry.content:
I could see some of the key challenges in your business process

  • Standard production logic assumes 1:1 input-output: If you order 2 pieces of 2m, SAP assumes you need 2 full rods unless you explicitly model the cutting logic.
  • Material master UoM limitations: Using meters vs. pieces can cause confusion in BOMs and routing.
  • Excess material reuse: SAP doesn’t automatically track leftover segments unless modeled explicitly.

You're absolutely right;  this is the most scalable and cloud-compatible approach.

  • Base UoM: Use PIECE for the rod (e.g., 1 piece = 6 meters).
  • Batch Characteristic: Define a characteristic like Length_in_Meters and assign it to the batch class.
  • When cutting, create two new batches:

V001X1000M → Batch with 1 meter
V001X5000M → Batch with 5 meters (excess)

This allows you to track exact lengths per batch, avoid creating multiple material masters for each cut size and can reuse leftover segments intelligently

Instead of standard production, consider modeling this as a rework or conversion process:

  • Create a custom production order type (e.g., “Cutting Order”).
  • Input: 1 piece of V001X6000M
  • Output: 1 piece of V001X1000M + 1 piece of V001X5000M
  • Use backflushing or manual goods movements to reflect the cut

This avoids BOM complexity and lets you control the flow more flexibly.

entry.title: Re: Factory Calendar configuration- Not able to create TR...
entry.content:
SCAL is client-dependent. Changes made via transaction SCAL (e.g., creating public holidays, holiday calendars, factory calendars) are not automatically linked to a transport request. For Golden Clients, in many SAP landscapes, the Golden Client is set up as a customizing client with no transport layer, or transport creation is restricted for certain objects like calendars.

If you're on S/4HANA Public Cloud, use SSCUI ID 180007 to configure and distribute calendar data. For more information, go through this blog 

Ask your Basis team to enable transport recording for SCAL changes. Use transaction SCAL, make changes, and then use Transport button to create TR manually. This may require authorization changes or client settings update

entry.title: Re: Tracking customer-owned RMAs in ECC
entry.content:
Some of the options which you can explore

Create a non-valuated dummy material to represent the RMA in transit. Post a goods issue from the GR plant using movement type 551E (scrapping customer-owned stock) or custom movement type. Post a goods receipt in the repair plant using 501E (receipt of customer-owned stock). This simulates the transfer and lets you track the RMA in the second plant. This doesn’t move the actual stock but gives visibility and audit trail. You’ll need to manually reconcile quantities.

Use a Z-table or Custom Report for RMA Location Tracking. Here create a simple Z-table to log RMA number, Customer, Material, GR plant Repair plant, Current status. Update this table manually or via a lightweight enhancement in MIGO or MB1B. Use it for reporting and tracking without changing core logistics flows.

Use Batch Classification with Plant info. Assign a batch number to each RMA item. Use batch characteristics to tag the current physical plant. Even if the material stays in the same SAP plant, you can reflect its actual location via classification.

Use Stock Transport Order (STO) with Non-Valuated Stock. If your system allows it, create a Stock Transport Order between plants using non-valuated customer-owned stock. This requires configuration to allow STOs for special stock ‘E’, which may be limited in ECC. If not feasible, simulate the STO using manual postings and tracking.

What S/4HANA will offer you is when you move to S/4HANA, this entire process becomes much cleaner with Advanced Returns Management (ARM):

  • You can create return orders that track the RMA from receipt to inspection to repair.
  • ARM supports cross-plant logistics, including repair in a different plant.
  • You get full document flow, status tracking, and integration with Quality Management and Warehouse Management.

entry.title: मीशो में शिकायत कैसे दर्ज करें?
entry.content: कस्टमर केयर नंबर का उपयोग करके शिपिंग के बाद मीशो पर ऑर्डर रद्द करें आप ऐप के माध्यम से मीशो पर शिप किए गए ऑर्डर को भी रद्द कर सकते हैं। शिप किए गए संदेश प्रदर्शित होने के बाद मीशो में ऑर्डर रद्द करने का तरीका इस प्रकार है: आप उनके हेल्पलाइन नंबर 91 967~986~70~61 पर डायल कर सकते हैं।

entry.title: Re: safety stock caluclation in VM - Automatic reorder po...
entry.content:
Some of the reasons why the values could be different are

SAP rounds intermediate values (MAD, W, SS) differently than manual Excel calculations. Even small decimal differences can shift the final reorder point.

You’ve used 30 days as forecast period consistently, but SAP might adjust this based on calendar days vs. workdays. If your planned delivery time is 15 calendar days, and SAP treats forecast period as 30 workdays, W becomes skewed.

SAP may recalculate MAD dynamically based on the forecast horizon and consumption variability. Your MAD is fixed at 41, but SAP might adjust it slightly depending on the forecast model used (e.g., constant vs. trend).

What you can do is check the R value SAP uses for 99% SL. If it’s slightly higher than 2.33, your SS will be higher. Validate W by confirming if SAP is using calendar days or workdays for forecast period and lead time. Review Forecast Model in MP30: If it’s set to automatic model selection, SAP might switch between constant/trend models, affecting MAD. Use Transaction MD04 to inspect how SAP calculates the reorder point and safety stock in real time.

entry.title: Re: Task list operations selection within PM orders
entry.content: In ECC6, the only partial workaround is via Extras → Settings → Default Values in IW31/IW32. You can enable “Operation select” and “Work center selection”. This gives a basic popup for selecting operations, but still lacks search/filter or banking capabilities. There’s no standard enhancement in ECC6 that introduces a search bar or operation banking. You can consider exploring custom screens or user exits, but these require development effort and don’t scale well.

entry.title: Re: Complex Multi-Rater Performance Rating Overall Calculations in SAP SuccessFactors Integration Ce
entry.content:
@IVR1  Hi, sorry for the delay because I generally login SAP community weekly.

Regarding your question, I believe that normalizing the score is not an appropriate approach. In fact, it is impractical, as assigning a precise proportion of competency requirements to each job role is not feasible. Since different roles demand varying levels of competency, it is essential to take job level into consideration when making comparisons across employees at different levels.

In my view, it would be more meaningful in this case to evaluate the competency score gap rather than focusing solely on the absolute score. Additionally, it would be advisable to include the job role, expected score and rating as a point of reference in the report.

If you would discuss it further, you could contact me in LinkedIn. Thanks.

entry.title: Re: One-Click Export-Automating SuccessFactors EC API Metadata to Excel

@RafaelSilv_Oliv  The source code is shared now in One-Click Export-Automating SuccessFactors EC New Hire Integration API Document--Optimization, you could use Cursor, Visual Studio Code or any other IDE with AI copilot to review, update or debug according to your requirement.

Because the excel is unsupported to upload, please contact me via LinkedIn. Thank for your understanding.

entry.title: users who did not complete an item that is revised by the item connect
entry.content:
Dear Experts,

We have used the item connector for update information of sevearl item, 

when updating an item in LMS, the system created a new  new Assigned Date record for the users who had that item. The solution was to modify the parameter  item.connector.defaultValue.revision.updateLearningPlans set to N , which resolved the issue for new loads performed through the connector. However the system already have created a new  new Assigned Date record for the users who had that item

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2865965

 

Now, we are looking for an option to remove those assignments that were generated for 6,000 users. However, when trying to delete the second record, the system deletes the first one instead.

What is the best option for solve this issue?

Regards

entry.title: Re: Can I install multiple versions of SAP Crystal Report...
entry.content:
I've never tried Ido's solution, typically you can't mix versions, but Ido's is very creative so if he says it works then it likely does. When upgrading the CR for VS installer will uninstall the old version and upgrade to the latest MSI you install. Most of the time, it's better to manually uninstall the old runtime before upgrading.

I assume Ido's fix is you manually install the x86 MSI package for SP 18 and the 64 bit MSI for SP 38. Note you can get the MSI packages from here:

https://origin.softwaredownloads.sap.com/public/site/index.html

Also to be clear the 13.0.2000.0 and 13.0.4000.0 are the framework versions required CR to run. The actual version is x64: 13.0.38.5404

Look in Programs and Features to see the version number.

There may be a possible solution for you though, see this KBA:

2719939 - Crystal Reports for Visual Studio Runtime versioning - side by side ability - what to do with WinFormCRViewer.zip from download WIKI

https://userapps.support.sap.com/sap/support/knowledge/en/2719939

Note, due to upgrades on the SAP site the zip file is no longer available but the KBA has info on how to use the redirect for the old programs to use the latest runtime.

You basically create a config file for those older programs to load the updated MSI packages and set them to the older version using a redirect command. Note the KBA is quite old so not 100% sure it works with the latest.

Also note that at the end of this year, 2025, the no longer will be 32 bit runtime available, R&D determined since 32 is old enough that you no longer need to build 32 bit applications, all versions of Windows can use 64 bit OS's. And 32 bit versions of Windows is not supported.

Time to upgrade those legacy applications to 64 bit platforms. Check with the makers to see if they have updates. If they are internal app's then simply rebuild them using the latest SP. See this blog I wrote on upgrading:

https://community.sap.com/t5/technology-blog-posts-by-sap/upgrading-a-visual-studio-2008-gt-2022-net-project-with-the-latest-cr-net/ba-p/13469215

The other issue could be CR for VS uses Microsoft app rules and they changed, the CR assemblies are now in a different location.

The old location was under this tree: C:\Windows\assembly

It's now under this tree: C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\assembly

To sum up:

1. CR's SP 18 is very old, missing a lot of the security and dependencies require

2. 32 bit application support is ending this year

3. Third party dependencies have also ended for the older version.

4. If needed you can still compile your app use X86 in the TheCPU setting and using CR's x64 bit runtime. Changing the value to x86 mode you will see the CR assemblies still being directed to the x64 folder.

5. UPGRADE those older applications, it's the safest way to resolve this...

entry.title: Re: How does S/4HANA handle scenarios where the commodity...
entry.content:
In ECC, when the commodity code's unit of measure (UOM) differs from the material's base UOM, the system prompts you to enter a conversion factor during material master maintenance. This ensures correct reporting for Intrastat and foreign trade declarations.

However, in S/4HANA (especially from version 2020 onward), this conversion factor prompt is no longer available directly in the material master. SAP has restructured how commodity codes and UOM conversions are handled, particularly in the context of International Trade and Group Reporting.

In S/4HANA, commodity code maintenance is decoupled from the material master. You now use the Fiori app “Manage Commodity Codes” to Assign commodity codes, maintain UOMs and conversion factors and link them to material groups or product categories.

SAP expects conversion factors to be maintained via external trade data or custom tables, not manually in the material master. You can use custom logic or BAdIs to fetch conversion factors during reporting or declaration.

If you're uploading materials via LTMC or Migration Cockpit, you can include conversion factors in the Commodity Code template. This is the preferred method for initial data load or mass updates.

entry.title: Re: Condition Contract with Quantity Scale - Settlement A...
entry.content:
As of now, SAP S/4HANA does not offer a standard condition type like REBD for quantity-based contracts to manually adjust business volume. However, there are workarounds and enhancement options you can explore:

You can create a custom condition type (similar to REBD but for quantity) and configure it to post delta quantities. This requires defining a new condition type in Settlement Management and enhancing the settlement logic to consider this delta quantity during scale determination.

SAP allows manual business volume uploads via transaction WB2R_BUSVOL or through Fiori apps. You can upload missing quantities manually using Material, Customer, Contract reference, Quantity and UoM. This is especially useful when billing documents fail to post correctly or are missing due to master data issues.

You can implement this BAdI BADI_BUSINESS_VOLUME to inject additional business volume during the settlement process. This is the most flexible option and allows you to pull data from external sources, add missing quantities dynamically and ensure correct scale level is picked
